original: Eriksson, Erik Gustaf Hadar, civilingenjör, disponent, Oskarshamn, f. 11/1/88 i Kolbäck, Västmanl. 1., av Gustaf E. o. Anna Olson. G. 18 m. Gunhild Grauers. Barn: Rolf f. 20, Margit 23, Karin 24. — Stud:ex. i Västerås 06, avg:ex. fr. KTH (E) 09. Res. t. USA 11-14 o. Ryssl. 15. Anst. v. telegr :v. 10-11, konstr. v. Sprague Electric Co. i Watsessing, N. J., USA, v. Frank Mossberg Co. i Attleboro, Conn., o. v. Standard Steel Car Co. i Butler, Pa., 11-14, v. ASEA 14-16, v. A-B Zander & Ingeström 16, disp. v. Sv. Ackumulator A-B Jungner i Oskarshamn sed. 16. Fd. led. av las:direkt. sed. 30, ordf. i vatten- o. elverket 22-32, krigsmat :v. krigsind:-omb. f. Kalmar 1. sed. 44. Led. av Sv. tekn:fören. sed. 07. RVO 37.
translated: Eriksson, Erik Gustaf Hadar, engineer, manager, from Oskarshamn, born January 11, 1888 in Kolbäck, Västmanland, son of Gustaf E. and Anna Olson. Married in 1918 to Gunhild Grauers. Children: Rolf, born 1920, Margit, born 1923, Karin, born 1924. He took his studentexamen (high school diploma) in Västerås in 1906 and graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology (E) in 1909. He went to the USA from 1911-1914 and to Russia in 1915. He worked for the Telegraph Administration from 1910-1911, as a designer for Sprague Electric Co. in Watsessing, N.J., USA, for Frank Mossberg Co. in Attleboro, Conn., and for Standard Steel Car Co. in Butler, Pa. from 1911-1914. He worked for ASEA from 1914-1916, A-B Zander & Ingeström 1916, and was manager of Sv. Ackumulator A-B Jungner in Oskarshamn from 1916. Former member of the board of directors of Laxåverken from 1930, chairman of the water and power plant 1922-1932, and war food inspector and war industry representative for Kalmar County since 1944. Member of Swedish Technical Association since 1907. He was awarded RVO in 1937.
